ca.mcgill.ecse211.lab5

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.lab5.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class implements an Odometer thread, which updates the robot's X, Y and theta coordinates as it moves.
    Author:
    Tony

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Odometer getOdometer()
      Method that returns an Odometer object, use this method to obtain an instance of Odometer.
      double[] getXYT()
      This method returns the Odometer data.
      void run()
      This method constantly updates the coordinates of the current position of the robot.
      void setXYT(double x, double y, double theta)
      This method overrides the values of x, y and theta
      void update(double dx, double dy, double dtheta)
      This method adds dx, dy and dtheta to the current values of x, y and theta, respectively

    • Method Detail

      • getOdometer

        public static Odometer getOdometer()
        Method that returns an Odometer object, use this method to obtain an instance of Odometer.
        Returns:
        an Odometer object

      • run

        public void run()
        This method constantly updates the coordinates of the current position of the robot.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getXYT

        public double[] getXYT()
        This method returns the Odometer data.

        Writes the current position and orientation of the robot onto the odoData array. odoData[0] = x, odoData[1] = y; odoData[2] = theta;

        Returns:
        the odometer readings

      • update

        public void update(double dx,
                   double dy,
                   double dtheta)
        This method adds dx, dy and dtheta to the current values of x, y and theta, respectively
        Parameters:
        dx - x update
        dy - y update
        dtheta - theta update

      • setXYT

        public void setXYT(double x,
                   double y,
                   double theta)
        This method overrides the values of x, y and theta
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x
        y - the value of y
        theta - the value of theta in degrees
